channel.title: Comments on: Easier low memory warning simulator testing with keyboard shortcuts
channel.description: iOS Frameworks for speech recognition, text to speech and more

item.title: By: Halle
item.dc:creator: Halle
item.description: Nice, thank you tupakapoor for the info -- hope this helps others.
item.content:encoded: Nice, thank you tupakapoor for the info — hope this helps others.

item.title: By: tupakapoor
item.dc:creator: tupakapoor
item.description:
If you symlink the iOS Simulator to be in the Applications folder this will work:
ln -s /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Applications/iOS\ Simulator.app /Applications/iOS\ Simulator.app
item.content:encoded:
If you symlink the iOS Simulator to be in the Applications folder this will work:

ln -s /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Applications/iOS\ Simulator.app /Applications/iOS\ Simulator.app

item.title: By: Halle
item.dc:creator: Halle
item.description: Wow, that is annoying. I'll give it some thought.
item.content:encoded: Wow, that is annoying. I’ll give it some thought.

item.title: By: Carl
item.dc:creator: Carl
item.description: It's a tragedy that above method is no longer available in 4.3.1 xcode (lion). cause 'iPhone Simulator.app' located in /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/Applications/iPhone Simulator.app , and we can not access inside of Xcode.app at Application Shortcuts preference pane. Is there anyone who help me?
item.content:encoded:
It’s a tragedy that above method is no longer available in 4.3.1 xcode (lion). cause ‘iPhone Simulator.app’ located in /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/Applications/iPhone Simulator.app , and we can not access inside of Xcode.app at Application Shortcuts preference pane.
Is there anyone who help me?

item.title: By: AD
item.dc:creator: AD
item.description: Thank you. Just what I wanted.

item.title: By: Halle
item.dc:creator: Halle
item.description: Hi Adam, glad you found it helpful.
item.content:encoded: Hi Adam, glad you found it helpful.

item.title: By: Adam McDonald
item.dc:creator: Adam McDonald
item.description: Greatly appreciated tip! Been looking for a slick solution like this for a while.
item.content:encoded: Greatly appreciated tip! Been looking for a slick solution like this for a while.
